title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.20 | 17-04-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञानति मिरान्दस्या ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षुरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मै श्री गुरवे नमः
नमा ओम विष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्रीमते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामेन्निति नामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेशा शुन्यवादी पाश्चात्यदेशतारिने जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभूलित्यानन्दा
श्री अद्वै तगदाधर श्रीवासाधीगोरभक्त वृण्धा. हरे कृष्ण, हरे कृष्ण, कृष्णकृष्ण, हरे हरे. हरे राम, हरे राम, राम राम, हरे हरे. ओम्नमो όभगवते वासुदेवाया नारायणम नमस्कृत्या नर� dominance even there.
देवीम् सरस्वतीम् व्यासं ततो जयम् उदीरयेत्
In this session we will be discussing from the 20th verse of the 9th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
यम् मन्यसे मातुलेयं प्रियं मित्रं सुहृत्तमं अकरो सचिवं दूतं सवृदाद अथ सारतिम्
The meaning of this verse is, O King, it's again Bhishma Deva addressing King Yudhishthira and the other assembled sages.

O King, that personality whom, out of ignorance only, you thought to be your maternal cousin, your very dear friend, well-wisher, counselor, messenger, benefactor, etc., is that very personality of Godhead Shri Krishna.
भीष्म देवीम् सरस्वतीम् व्यासं ततो जयम् उदीरयेत्

भीष्म देवीम् सरस्वतीम् व्यासं ततो जयम् उदीरयेत्
sun is identified with every inch of the sun rays the sun is somewhere in the
spiritual sky millions of miles away from the earth but the sunshine is
coming to the earth and providing heat and light and energy and sustaining life
on this planet so that sunshine is in one sense not different from the Sun is
the energy of the Sun and we can identify the Sun as full of this energy
which we call sunshine sun rays similarly the Lord is distributed by his
different energies the Lord is present by virtue of his being present as energy
his own energy spread everywhere he is Paramatma the super soul present in
everything that is present in the universe and in the universe and in the
universe and everyone has a supreme guidance not only Krishna's energies is
spread everywhere in this material world as a material energy he is also entered
into everyone's heart every living beings heart as the super soul as the
Paramatma that is another form of krishna who is an expansion of krishna
was entered into everybody's heart and he is giving guidance to every living
heart and he is giving guidance to every living being from within the heart
therefore Krishna is already the chariot driver and counsel of every living being
Sarathi he is not just guiding Arjuna alone he is guiding everyone as the
Paramatma in their heart so therefore proper is explaining how when Krishna
exhibits himself as chariot driver of Arjuna there is no change in his
exalted position he is already seated in Arjuna's heart as the Paramatma he is
guiding Arjuna so externally when he apparently becomes the chariot dr.
arjuna and guides arjuna while driving his chariot there's no change in his position
so it is only because of the devotional service that arjuna wants to render to krishna
krishna agrees to become arjuna's chariot driver
otherwise to give guidance to arjuna krishna is already in arjuna's heart what is the need for
krishna to come externally appear as the chariot driver of arjuna there is no need
then prabhupada explains he does that for the sake of teaching the others not arjuna
for the sake of teaching others he speaks the bhagavad-gita
to arjuna even though he is a chariot driver of arjuna he is the lord and he speaks bhagavad-gita
and through arjuna he is instructing and educating the whole world so this is the
absolute nature of krishna for krishna there is nothing superior and inferior action
when he is instructing arjuna as the spiritual master of arjuna he is in apparently in a superior
position arjuna is submitting surrendering and arjuna is inquiring from krishna kindly guide me
kindly instruct me kindly enlighten me and krishna is instructing enlighting arjuna
so superior position when arjuna is ordering take my chariot between the two
armies krishna is in a inferior position apparently but actually it is explained
krishna being absolute there is no difference between his superior position and inferior
position in his relationship with his devotees he remains always the supreme lord he may assume any

He may do any activity inferior or superior according to our calculation, but as far as Krishna is concerned, it is simply his loving reciprocation with his devotees, whether it is Mother Yashoda, whether it is Radharani, whether it is Arjuna, whether it is any devotee, even Bhishma, we will hear how Bhishma is praying to Krishna, kindly be present before me at the time of my death, quitting the body.
And Krishna fulfilled Bhishma's request very graciously. So that is the loving relationship between Krishna and his devotees. I will stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
